content:
Answer: d. Possess doctoral degrees.

Explanation: Physicians are typically medical doctors who have completed doctoral degrees in medicine (MD) or osteopathic medicine (DO). This distinguishes them from other medical care providers such as nurses, physician assistants, and nurse practitioners who may hold different degrees or certifications. While physicians may also be sued for medical malpractice, perform complex surgical operations, and complete continuing education courses, these characteristics are not unique to physicians and may also apply to other healthcare professionals.

Bloom's Taxonomy Level: Knowledge
